pullRequest.body:
add a type of Katetov maps (one point extensions of a metric) and related notation and FunLike coercions.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: please mark as `awaiting-review` if it's ready for review

> please mark as `awaiting-review` if it's ready for review

Sorry, I had marked it `awaiting-review` and then unmarked it since I was considering changing the notation, but I think it is fine now.
Are you planning to continue working on this PR? If not, please feel free to close it.
I am, starting in August. I had removed awaiting-review so that it wouldnâ€™t bother mantainers while I was not actively working on it, but that appears to have failed : )
No problem! We're just trying to get on top of PRs from new contributors. Looking forward to seeing more here when you're ready. :-)

Thanks for your PR. My apologies that you had to wait for feedback for a long time.

I left some comments, which are hopefully helpful. If you want more details, please let me know.

Thanks for your PR. My apologies that you had to wait for feedback for a long time.

I left some comments, which are hopefully helpful. If you want more details, please let me know.

```suggestion
/-- A real valued function from a metric space is Katetov if
```

```suggestion
/-- A real valued function `f` on a metric space is Katetov if
  it is 1-Lipschitz and for all `x` and `y` we have `dist x y â‰¤ f x + f y`. -/
```
The docstrings below will not show up if someone hovers over `IsKatetov` in another file. That's why it's good to include the properties in this docstring as well.

```suggestion
  protected isKatetov : IsKatetov toFun
```
Please make this notation scoped, so that it can be selectively enabled in other files.
Nothing else in this file mention "Kuratowski". Is it intentional?

My bad, the thing is I have a big file with the construction of the Urysohn space (using Katetov maps) and Iâ€™m splitting it into pieces to have small PRs, that was a leftover from the larger file. Iâ€™ll remove it and add it back into the next PR : )
How does "one point extension of a metric" relate to the definition below? Please add some explanation for users like me who never used Katetov maps.

The idea is that if you have a one point pseudometric extension of a pseudometric space X, call it X âˆª {p}, then f(x) = dist(x, p) is a katetov map on X. Vice versa, if you have f(x) that is Katetov, then setting dist(p, x) = f(x) (and using the distance of X otherwise) makes X âˆª {p} into a pseudometric space, but let me just remove that, itâ€™s easy to prove and conceptually useful but it never appears in any proof in practice.

I don't see why we should have it as a separate lemma. The coercion will be `DFunLike.coe (Subtype.val f)` anyway, so we can just use `f.1.isKatetov` directly and get a syntactically equivalent statement.
Honestly this was mindlessly copy-pasted from the ContinuousMap case, Iâ€™ll remove it.
You already proved this as a part of `FunLike` instance. You can either drop this lemma and use `DFunLike.coe_injective` directly, or replace the proof with `DFunLike.coe_injective`

pullRequest.title: feat(Topology/MetricSpace): Add new file with type of Katetov maps
